intro: Mahurea casiquiarensis, commonly known as the Casiquiare river hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically the Amazon Basin. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near waterways. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
